description: Guru Rinpoche Day is dedicated to the veneration of Guru Padmasambhava (Guru Rinpoche), revered as the second Buddha and credited with bringing Buddhism to Tibet and the Himalayan region. Observances include prayers, rituals, and cultural programs reflecting his life and teachings.

Cham Mask Dance is a traditional Tibetan Buddhist ritual dance performed by monks in elaborate masks and costumes. It serves as both a meditative practice and a dramatic re-enactment of Buddhist stories, symbolizing the triumph of good over evil and the purification of negativity.

Pang Lhabsol is devoted to the worship of Mount Kanchenjunga, Sikkim’s guardian deity. The festival features rituals and dances seeking the mountain god’s blessings for protection, harmony, and prosperity, with unique masked performances.

The Butter Lamp Festival (Ghee Lamp Festival) involves lighting hundreds of lamps in monasteries to symbolize the dispelling of darkness and ignorance. The event includes prayers, chanting, and collective offerings for peace and prosperity.

Cham Mask Dance is a traditional Tibetan Buddhist ritual dance performed by monks in elaborate masks and costumes. It serves as both a meditative practice and a dramatic re-enactment of Buddhist stories, symbolizing the triumph of good over evil and the purification of negativity.

Pang Lhabsol is devoted to the worship of Mount Kanchenjunga, Sikkim’s guardian deity. The festival features rituals and dances seeking the mountain god’s blessings for protection, harmony, and prosperity, with unique masked performances.

Cham Mask Dance is a traditional Tibetan Buddhist ritual dance performed by monks in elaborate masks and costumes. It serves as both a meditative practice and a dramatic re-enactment of Buddhist stories, symbolizing the triumph of good over evil and the purification of negativity.

The Annual Prayer Gathering sees large groups of monks and devotees conducting extended prayers for world peace, well-being, and prosperity. The gathering features recitations, ritual offerings, and fosters spiritual renewal in the community.

The Butter Lamp Festival (Ghee Lamp Festival) involves lighting hundreds of lamps in monasteries to symbolize the dispelling of darkness and ignorance. The event includes prayers, chanting, and collective offerings for peace and prosperity.
Saga Dawa commemorates the birth, enlightenment, and death of Lord Buddha. It is marked by prayers, circumambulations, acts of merit like lamp-lighting and animal release, and charitable activities.

The Annual Prayer Gathering sees large groups of monks and devotees conducting extended prayers for world peace, well-being, and prosperity. The gathering features recitations, ritual offerings, and fosters spiritual renewal in the community.

The Bumchu Festival centers on the ritual opening of a sacred vase, whose water level is seen as foretelling Sikkim’s fortunes. The festival features blessings, distribution of holy water, and communal prayers and feasting.
Drupchen is an intensive Buddhist retreat ceremony involving days of collective prayer, creation of mandalas, ritual dances, and offerings to invoke deity blessings and remove obstacles.

The Annual Prayer Gathering sees large groups of monks and devotees conducting extended prayers for world peace, well-being, and prosperity. The gathering features recitations, ritual offerings, and fosters spiritual renewal in the community.
Saga Dawa commemorates the birth, enlightenment, and death of Lord Buddha. It is marked by prayers, circumambulations, acts of merit like lamp-lighting and animal release, and charitable activities.
Drupchen is an intensive Buddhist retreat ceremony involving days of collective prayer, creation of mandalas, ritual dances, and offerings to invoke deity blessings and remove obstacles.

The Bumchu Festival centers on the ritual opening of a sacred vase, whose water level is seen as foretelling Sikkim’s fortunes. The festival features blessings, distribution of holy water, and communal prayers and feasting.

Pang Lhabsol is devoted to the worship of Mount Kanchenjunga, Sikkim’s guardian deity. The festival features rituals and dances seeking the mountain god’s blessings for protection, harmony, and prosperity, with unique masked performances.

The Butter Lamp Festival (Ghee Lamp Festival) involves lighting hundreds of lamps in monasteries to symbolize the dispelling of darkness and ignorance. The event includes prayers, chanting, and collective offerings for peace and prosperity.
